titleStmt.title: Unknown et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4883

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos. Bramlet
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky.

Your petitioners would respectfully represent to your Excellency that at the April term 1864 of the Union Circuit Court. Robert Ransom was convicted of suffering and permitting gaming in his house at which whiskey Brandy and Beer was won and lost. Under the instructions of the Court, the Jury were bound to find him guilty and affixed the lowest penalty of the law to wit two Hundred dollars. We are convinced from the Evidence that Mr Ransom did ^not^ intend or contemplate a breach of law in allowing said games and that the fine is greatly too large and onerous for the offence We therefore pray your Excellency to remit said fine and we of the Jury who were impaneled in and tried said case recommend Mr Ransom to the clemency of Your Excellency and in our opinion have no hesitancy in saying that he is worthy of it and that clemency should be extended to him All of which is respectfully submitted

Names of the Jury who tried the cause
Louis Fiefsinger
Wm X Bery
Joseph Potts
J. G. Filpinger
John P Medley
Thee Boone
Jones Hill Jurey
H Weil
John T Seat Jurey
C B Hayer Jurey
Logan Brown
H B Riddle
E. M. Gilmore
Wm. P. Riggs
John B. Albert
James Agin
William A Smith
B J Berans
Mynes Griggs
John Graham
G W Raley
F. A Brooks
B M Winston
Hiram Smith Jr
R A Spacoing (Dont Do so agin)
M. R. Waller
Robert Spalding A Juror
George W Anderson Juror
P A Hager
I was a Juror at the Oct term 1863 when there was a mistrial
E. G. Smith (a Juror)
John, S, Bowen (a Juror)
Samuel Poor (a Juror)
W B Scott (a Juror)
F.. wathers (a Juror)
Names of Juror at the last October term when there was a Mistrial

Enclosed is a petition which We hope you have time to examine & act on as soon as possible. You will the names of all the Jurors who tried the case except one, who would have signed it but was absent at his home.

The following are the Jurors who tried the case of the Commlth agst Robt Ransom To wit: Saml Por, E. G Smith, C B. Hagar, J. V. Brown, J. S Bowen, Wm Holt J. L. Scott, & James Hill of the regular pannell and Washington Perry, Geo W. Anderson, Frank Wathers and Robt Spalding from the bystander. Given under my hand as Clerk of the Union Circuit Court.
D. C. James C. U. C. C
